{"step_by_step_thinking": "The maxillary sinus is one of the four pairs of paranasal sinuses that are situated in the skull. It continues to grow until the second decade of life. The ethmoidal sinus is fully developed at birth. The frontal sinus does not begin to develop until around the age of seven and continues to grow until early adulthood. The sphenoid sinus also begins to pneumatize around age three, but it does not reach full size until adolescence.", "answer_choice": "C. Frontal"}
